section.title: Important Notice
section.p: IMPORTANT: Before posting a question or problem to any mailing list, please first look at the following resources in this order:

ol.li: ODP XML links - a wealth of general XML information.
Mailing list archives - a veritable goldmine of Forrest-specific information - if you know where to look!

section.p: IMPORTANT: Careful postings please. These are high-volume lists, so we all needs ways to help us all work smarter. See tips for Contributing

section.title: Forrest Dev
section.p: This list is for developers working on or wanting to work on Forrest itself (not developers merely working with Forrest), for code patches to Forrest to be posted (please use diff -u format), and for general Forrest questions.
This is also not an appropriate list for general Java questions. Instead try news:comp.lang.java.help or http://hotdispatch.com/, for example.
This is not an appropriate list for general XML questions. Instead look at the ODP for XML/XSL links (such as the excellent XSL tutorial at Zvon.org) or try the Mulberrytech XSL list.

IMPORTANT: If you are posting about a problem you are having (as most people do), it will aid in finding a speedy resolution if you provide full configuration details (especially the version number, but also your operating system, JDK version, and servlet engine), and full details of any errors encountered (including full error messages and stack traces).

section.title: Related Mailing Lists
section.p: (See also ODP XML links for related websites.)

ul.li: XML Apache Projects - list of mailing lists for all the projects on xml.apache.org.
Some servlet engines have their own mailing lists for servlet-engine configuration questions, such as tomcat-user (note it is "user" and not "users").
